name: Park Plaza Westminster Bridge London

reviews.text: We stayed in a studio suite. The beds were comfortable, with excellent pillows! Everything was well cleaned, sleek and modern. The front desk staff were helpful and were able to allow us to check into one of our two rooms early, since we had just flown a red-eye and needed to clean up a little before touring. The location of this hotel is amazing! We stayed here because it is close to everything, which allowed us to explore easily by foot. This is a fantastic hotel!
reviews.title: Super nice room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From a wheelchair users perspective this hotel is really quite good. Although there are two disabled access buttons on the outside these were not working during our stay but there was usually a doorman to open the door from the inside.
reviews.title: Wheelchair perspective

reviews.text: We stayed in room 375 and there was plenty of space in the room, I could get all the way round the room without any problem, although the bed was a little low for me. There is an automatic entry/exit button but it did take rather a long time to close, this is better than closing too quick but just make sure its shut before you leave.
reviews.title: Great location and spacious!

reviews.text: While the bathroom was 'compact' it was well thought out, I could get my legs under the lowered sink and grab rails were not only well placed the shower rails and seat were height adjustable. The magnified mirror was at a height I could reach and could be angled to use either seated or standing and even the waste bin was touch button instead of the usual foot pedal operated!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel with Outrageous staff

reviews.text: We found the staff very pleasant and helpful but it did take 3 phone calls to get a bulb replaced in the bathroom, & 2 calls to get a porterfor the luggage. The lighting was my biggest problem, the room lighting even on full was gloomy the bathroom lighting was not good enough to put make- up on and my husband struggled to shave. The corridors are also dimly lit and this would be a major problem for anyone who has visual ptoblems.
reviews.title: Great location for sightseeing , walking or taking the busses

reviews.text: Stayed here over the Queen's Jubilee weekend and had a family room as we had our 10 year old niece with us. The hotel is just at the end of Westminster Bridge and a 5 min walk from the London Eye. Also a short walk to the underground station so very convenient for visitors. The hotel is new. The family room has a sofa bed with it's own TV. The only time we ate in the hotel was we ordered room service one night and the food was fine. I would have so say only disappointment was the restaurant recommendation from the concierge when we found out that our favourite tapas restaurant was closed due to the Jubilee. He recommended a place on Southbank which was more Mexican than Spanish.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I'm French but as usual I'll write my review in English so that it can be useful for many strangers.
reviews.title: well situated but it's rather a tourists'factory

reviews.text: I went to this hotel for the last bank holidays in France called "ascension", with my boyfriend and two other friends for three nights. I bought this hotel via booking website. We took two studio rooms because we didn't want to be like hamsters in cages (rooms are with a view on the atrium).
reviews.title: hard to find a better location for sightseeing

reviews.text: The hotel is new, shinny, and appears to be a good deal, but stay away. This is a two star hotel masquerading as a four star property.
reviews.title: Two star hotel with rodents in the kitchen

reviews.text: RECOMMENDATION: Pick a different hotel. This is not the deal you think it is!
reviews.title: Central, huge, nice rooms no natural light if interior room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: New, comfortable bed and pillows, large modern bathroom, good air conditioner, illy bar in lobby makes a good latte.
reviews.title: I may have found my favorite hotel!!!!!

reviews.text: Cons: Internet didn't work, coarse and thin bath towels, elevator signals not very visible, poor in room coffee set up, terrible sushi restaurant, overpriced and underwhelming breakfast buffet, mice in the kitchen, rude service from nearly everyone.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel and good location

reviews.text: Good location, breakfast and rooms; BUT... if you book a "no view" room be aware that you may not see the day light and you cannot tell if it is day or night either. So do not look through the window... The hotel is a massive one and there is so manny people that you can be can be lead to a huge communist breakfast room, CANTINA like and you might not like this kind of treatment...
reviews.title: Inner city luxury, close to all the hot-spots

reviews.text: This is probably one of the best spots a visitor to London could ask for, so you really would have to recommend it for no other reason. It's fine. It's a good hotel that does well on many fronts. It's expensive, but the rooms are large and comfortable and the hotel facilities are good.
reviews.title: Great location, high price tag, lacking a little something

reviews.text: It drops the ball on a few fronts
reviews.title: Good place to stay with teen ager

reviews.text: 1) Instant coffee in the rooms - CMON! hotel management, buck your ideas up. This should be filter or nespresso. This sort of price tag does not attract Kenco instant drinkers and I'm not paying room service prices for a morning cup of fresh proper coffee.
reviews.title: Could not fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Next one can't be so easily fixed, but the rooms are over an atrium so inside rooms look out to the inside, no window, very dark and VERY stuffy
reviews.title: Great location for getting around

reviews.text: 3) Air con fans are loud and you have to have them on or suffocate (see 2 above). Bring earplugs.
reviews.title: No brainer

aka: Park Plaza Westminster Bridge London Hotel
